org.usfirst.frc.team2228.robot

Class Parameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team2228.robot.Parameters

  • public class Parameters
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    erichspaker@gmail.com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int button_invertDrive
      The button index to use for inverting the drive direction
      static int button_setRotation_four
      The button index to use for putting the robot into rotational sensitivity mode four rMode_limit_four
      static int button_setRotation_one
      The button index to use for putting the robot into rotational sensitivity mode one rMode_limit_one
      static int button_setRotation_three
      The button index to use for putting the robot into rotational sensitivity mode three rMode_limit_three
      static int button_setRotation_two
      The button index to use for putting the robot into rotational sensitivity mode two rMode_limit_two
      static int COUNTS_PER_REV
      This is the counts per revolution of the drivebases encoders
      static double initialDirection
      This is the initial orientation of the drive base To make the front of the robot forward for the joystick set this to Math.PI To make the back of the robot forward for the joystick set this to 0
      static double lMode_curvature
      This is the curve constant for the input to output function which AdvancedJoystick uses to get linear magnitude values This value will cause linear joystick movement to be less sensitive in small amounts than greater amounts A value of one will create a perfect curve, were-as a value of 0 will make it linear Set this to a middle value and fine tune for smoother driving Range: [0 - 1]
      static boolean lMode_invert
      Deprecated. 
      use initialDirection in drive base instead
      static double lMode_max
      This is the amount that you must move the joystick in order for getMagnitude() to return the current throttle axis' limit Range: [0 - 1] Must be greater than lMode_min
      static double lMode_maxLimit
      This is the cap for the robots speed when the throttle is all the way up speed cap (limit) is interpolated linearly between max and min throttle values Range: [0 - 1] Must be less than lMode_min
      static double lMode_min
      This is the minimum amount you must pull/push you must put on the joystick before the robot will move (motors are engaged) Any magnitude before this value will be treated as if the joystick is not being moved at all Range: [0 - 1) Must be less than lMode_max
      static double lMode_minLimit
      This is the cap for the robots speed when the throttle is all the way down speed cap (limit) is interpolated linearly between max and min throttle values Range: [0 - 1] Must be less than rMode_max
      static java.lang.String logLocation
      The file location to put log files If using a flash drive this should be somewhere under /U/
      static double maxCurrent
      Any in instance of the jaguars outputting more than this current will be logged A debug value
      static double ramp
      Time constant for motor ramping (Increment/Second) This is the factor of motor speed (percent out of one) to increment the motor speeds per second ex) a value of 1 will move a motor for 0 to 100 percent in one second
      static double rMode_curvature
      This is the curve constant for the input to output function which AdvancedJoystick uses to get rotational magnitude values This value will cause small amounts of rotation to be less sensitive than greater amounts A value of one will create a perfect curve, were-as a value of 0 will make it linear Set this to a middle value and fine tune for smoother driving Range: [0 - 1]
      static boolean rMode_invert
      Inverts rotational controls If this is true, twisting the joystick clockwise will rotate the robot counter-clockwise
      static double rMode_limit_four
      The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode four." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]
      static double rMode_limit_one
      The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode one." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]
      static double rMode_limit_three
      The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode three." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]
      static double rMode_limit_two
      The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode two." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]
      static double rMode_max
      This is the amount that you must twist the joystick in order for getTwist() to return the current sensitivity mode's limit Range: [0 - 1] Must be greater than rMode_min
      static double rMode_min
      This is the minimum amount you must twist the joystick before the robot will turn (motors are engaged) Any twist before this value will be treated as if the joystick is not being twisted at all Range: [0 - 1) Must be less than rMode_max

        public static int button_invertDrive
        The button index to use for inverting the drive direction

      • rMode_limit_one

        public static double rMode_limit_one
        The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode one." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]

      • rMode_limit_two

        public static double rMode_limit_two
        The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode two." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]

      • rMode_limit_three

        public static double rMode_limit_three
        The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode three." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]

      • rMode_limit_four

        public static double rMode_limit_four
        The maximum factor of rotation to use when the robot is in "rotational sensitivity mode four." In other words, this is the amount (out of one) that the robot will spin when you twist the joystick all the way Range: [0 - 1]

      • rMode_max

        public static double rMode_max
        This is the amount that you must twist the joystick in order for getTwist() to return the current sensitivity mode's limit Range: [0 - 1] Must be greater than rMode_min

      • rMode_min

        public static double rMode_min
        This is the minimum amount you must twist the joystick before the robot will turn (motors are engaged) Any twist before this value will be treated as if the joystick is not being twisted at all Range: [0 - 1) Must be less than rMode_max

      • rMode_curvature

        public static double rMode_curvature
        This is the curve constant for the input to output function which AdvancedJoystick uses to get rotational magnitude values This value will cause small amounts of rotation to be less sensitive than greater amounts A value of one will create a perfect curve, were-as a value of 0 will make it linear Set this to a middle value and fine tune for smoother driving Range: [0 - 1]

      • rMode_invert

        public static boolean rMode_invert
        Inverts rotational controls If this is true, twisting the joystick clockwise will rotate the robot counter-clockwise

      • lMode_max

        public static double lMode_max
        This is the amount that you must move the joystick in order for getMagnitude() to return the current throttle axis' limit Range: [0 - 1] Must be greater than lMode_min

      • lMode_min

        public static double lMode_min
        This is the minimum amount you must pull/push you must put on the joystick before the robot will move (motors are engaged) Any magnitude before this value will be treated as if the joystick is not being moved at all Range: [0 - 1) Must be less than lMode_max

      • lMode_maxLimit

        public static double lMode_maxLimit
        This is the cap for the robots speed when the throttle is all the way up speed cap (limit) is interpolated linearly between max and min throttle values Range: [0 - 1] Must be less than lMode_min

      • lMode_minLimit

        public static double lMode_minLimit
        This is the cap for the robots speed when the throttle is all the way down speed cap (limit) is interpolated linearly between max and min throttle values Range: [0 - 1] Must be less than rMode_max

      • lMode_curvature

        public static double lMode_curvature
        This is the curve constant for the input to output function which AdvancedJoystick uses to get linear magnitude values This value will cause linear joystick movement to be less sensitive in small amounts than greater amounts A value of one will create a perfect curve, were-as a value of 0 will make it linear Set this to a middle value and fine tune for smoother driving Range: [0 - 1]

      • lMode_invert

        public static boolean lMode_invert
        Deprecated. use initialDirection in drive base instead
        Set this to true to invert the joysticks linear control

      • initialDirection

        public static double initialDirection
        This is the initial orientation of the drive base To make the front of the robot forward for the joystick set this to Math.PI To make the back of the robot forward for the joystick set this to 0

      • COUNTS_PER_REV

        public static int COUNTS_PER_REV
        This is the counts per revolution of the drivebases encoders

      • ramp

        public static double ramp
        Time constant for motor ramping (Increment/Second) This is the factor of motor speed (percent out of one) to increment the motor speeds per second ex) a value of 1 will move a motor for 0 to 100 percent in one second

      • maxCurrent

        public static double maxCurrent
        Any in instance of the jaguars outputting more than this current will be logged A debug value

        public static java.lang.String logLocation
        The file location to put log files If using a flash drive this should be somewhere under /U/
